channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump shops for marble while in Florida
item.description: President Trump made a pit stop at a marble shop while in Florida on Friday, with plans to use the rock for the planned White House State Ballroom.

item.title: Let Freedom Ring in the Caribbean in 2026
item.description: From Venezuela to Cuba to Nicaragua, new opportunities.

item.title: Michigan college survey says ‘6-7’ is lowkey cooked, put in on the ‘Banished Words List’
item.description: The Lake Superior State University roundup of overused slang started in 1976 as a New Year’s Eve party idea.

item.title: Healthcare, economy and the 'One Big Beautiful Bill': Welcome to the midterms

item.title: Mamdani's first moves as mayor: Revoke Eric Adams' orders, create task forces on housing

item.title: Iran crackdown rattles Middle East as analysts weigh US options short of military intervention

item.title: FBI thwarts possible terrorist attack on New Year's Eve in North Carolina
item.description: The FBI announced it prevented a potential attack in support of the Islamic State terrorist group on New Year's Eve in North Carolina.

item.title: Mamdani's inauguration fuels debate over Gen Z shift toward socialism, away from free markets
item.description: Mamdani’s inauguration highlights a generational shift as Gen Z voters show growing openness to socialism.

item.title: 5 questions about Trump's furniture tariff delay and pasta tariff reduction

item.title: Michael Saylor’s Strategy flirts again with the danger threshold at which his company is worth less than his Bitcoin
item.description: Why hold a stock that is worth less than the underlying asset it represents?

item.title: DOJ demands voter data from Minnesota secretary of state
item.description: The Trump administration amped up the pressure on Minnesota to hand over voter data, with the head of the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division s...

item.title: Bishop Robert Barron slams Zohran Mamdani's 'warmth of collectivism' line: ‘For God’s sake’

item.title: It’s Time To Cancel Our Subscription Culture Once And For All
item.description: A new cancel culture is coming. Consumerism, bad customer service, and corporations beware!

item.title: California, and the Worst Wealth Tax in the World
item.description: The state that gave the world Silicon Valley is now openly flirting with the very policies that ensured Europe never produced one.

item.title: Tesla is officially smaller than China’s BYD in EV sales as it reports second-straight year of falling sales
item.description: Tesla stock is down over 6% over the last five days but the market seemed to be expecting Friday's news about EV deliveries.

item.title: Runaway boulder on Indiana Jones set rolls over Disney World worker
item.description: “We’re focused on supporting our cast member, who is recovering," Disney said in a statement.

item.title: Jim Jarmusch Deconstructs Himself
item.description: Father Mother Sister Brother makes hipness a family trait.

item.title: One Man’s ‘Warmth of Collectivism’ Is Another’s Inferno
item.description: The authors of Mamdani’s inaugural address appear to genuinely believe true socialism has never been tried.

item.title: Betty Boop and Blondie join Mickey Mouse and Winnie the Pooh in the public domain
item.description: “It’s a big year,” said Jennifer Jenkins of Duke’s Center for the Study of the Public Domain. “It's just the sheer familiarity of all this culture.”

item.title: Washington officials blast conservatives for Minnesota-style day care fraud claims in new state
item.description: Citizen journalists film alleged fraudulent daycare addresses in Washington, claiming 539 centers list Somali as primary language.

item.title: It’s Not Just Minnesota. The Vast Majority Of Daycare Is A Scam
item.description: Taxpayers have spent hundreds of billions more on completely ineffective daycare than even Somalis have been able to pilfer.

item.title: Without George Washington, America Wouldn’t Have A 250th Birthday
item.description: No one looms larger in the story of our nation's struggle for independence than George Washington, who today seems almost mythical.

item.title: What the Debates over American Heritage Are Really About
item.description: The wars that someone’s ancestors fought in are beside the point.
